Builtin Exceptions

1. RouteNotFoundException

Dinoloop throws RouteNotFoundException when it receives a request that does not match an endpoint. The request continues only if the endpoint (i.e. action method) is found.

List of properties

  • this.httpVerb: string - placeholder for HttpVerb request
  • this.requestUrl: string - placeholder for endpoint
  • this.type: string - placeholder for exception type
  • this.message: string - placeholder for custom message

Here is how you can handle your own version of the ServerError middleware


    

    
    
        
  • It is a run time exception which can be caught by the ServerError middlewares
    • 
        
  • It is simple to setup error-middlewares and add custom response.
    • 
        
  • It is recommended to register
            RouteNotFoundErrorMiddleware as the first ServerError middleware.
    • 
    

    
2. InvalidRouteException

    
Dinoloop throws
        InvalidRouteException when null/undefined values are provided as route paths to
        @Controller(null) or
        @Controller(undefined) or other http verbs like
        @HttpGet. 

    
List of properties

    
    
        
  • 
            this.httpVerb: string - placeholder for HttpVerb request
    • 
        
  • 
            this.action: string - placeholder for action method
    • 
        
  • 
            this.controller: string - placeholder for controller
    • 
        
  • 
            this.route: string - placeholder for complete endpoint
    • 
        
  • 
            this.message: string - placeholder for custom message
    • 
    

    
It is a compile time exception which occurs while Dino starts binding routes to Expressjs. This exception does not require
        setting up the ServerError middleware.

    
3. CustomException

    
Programmers from C#/Java have robust support for exception handling. Dinoloop team suggests to create a
        CustomException
        class and derive all your exceptions from it.

    

        

    

    
    
        
  • One good reason is to to hold an inner exception whereas the native javascript Error does not.
    •
